subsections.title: Livingston Overview
highlights: Historic railroad town turned artsy mountain hub
Nestled along the Yellowstone River with Paradise Valley access
Known for fly fishing, literary ties, and charming downtown

subsections.title: Gardiner Overview
highlights: Yellowstone’s only year-round entrance (North Entrance)
Home to Roosevelt Arch and Yellowstone River gateway
Small-town base for wildlife, hot springs, and park access

subsections.title: Dining & Coffee – Livingston
highlights: Gil’s Goods – wood-fired pizzas, hearty breakfast
Faye's Café – seasonal, creative breakfast & brunch
Neptunes Brewery – local favorite with pub fare
Treeline Coffee – great for a travel stop recharge

subsections.title: Dining & Coffee – Gardiner
highlights: Yellowstone Pizza Company – scenic rooftop view
Iron Horse Bar & Grill – hearty American eats
Tumbleweed Bookstore & Café – cozy stop with coffee
Wonderland Café – good food, beer, and vibes

subsections.title: Lodging & Campgrounds
highlights: Murray Hotel – historic downtown Livingston stay
Yellowstone Gateway Inn – extended stays in Gardiner
Mammoth Campground (inside park, year-round)
Livingston KOA & Yellowstone RV Park – riverfront access

subsections.title: Fly Fishing & Outdoor Activities
highlights: Yellowstone River fly fishing (guided or DIY)
Floating & kayaking between Livingston and Gardiner
Hiking Pine Creek Falls or Passage Creek near Livingston
Gardiner rafting and Lamar Valley wildlife watching

subsections.title: Hot Springs Access
highlights: Chico Hot Springs – historic lodge + soaking pool
Yellowstone Hot Springs – newer facility near Gardiner
Boiling River (closed indefinitely) – once popular swim spot
Private tubs available at some lodging in Paradise Valley

subsections.title: Museums & History
highlights: Livingston Depot Museum – railroad and regional history
Park County Museum – small but rich exhibits
Roosevelt Arch – historic North Entrance to Yellowstone

subsections.title: Events & Local Culture
highlights: Livingston Roundup Rodeo (July 2–4)
Art walks and gallery openings (summer)
Live music at Pine Creek Lodge & Murray Bar
Gardiner 4th of July Parade and Old West Days

subsections.title: Loop Integration & Travel Tips
highlights: Start your Yellowstone loop in Gardiner for wildlife at dawn
Stay in Livingston for charming evenings and dining
Use Highway 89 for a scenic Paradise Valley drive
Expect elk traffic in Gardiner and hot springs crowds in summer
